metadata.title: CVE-2014-1716 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the Runtime_SetPrototypefunction in runtime.cc in Google V8, as used in Google Chrome before34.0.1847.116, allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script orHTML via unspecified vectors, aka "Universal XSS (UXSS)."

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-1716` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 34.0.1847.116-0ubuntu2
chromium-browser-l10n - 34.0.1847.116-0ubuntu2
chromium-chromedriver - 34.0.1847.116-0ubuntu2
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 34.0.1847.116-0ubuntu2
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 34.0.1847.116-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '34.0.1847.116-0ubuntu2').
libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
